intro: Brachypterys paralais, commonly known as the Paralais brachypterys, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Brachypterys paralais is adapted to the tropical climate of Madagascar and is found in moist, shaded habitats.
